dmKg4D_kFzgh1oSr6WdB6w.text: This hip and trendy vegan place is awesome if you are after a quick and tasty stop for food.  The interior is clean and fresh and so is the food. There isn't many places to sit so wouldn't recommend for more than 2/4 people unless you plan on taking away. The price is right and a soup and salad costing 8. The soup was flavourful and tummy warming. And the salad was Dank! (in a good way) fresh and tasty dressing makes the bowl the best!  Would definitely recommend to a friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Pumpkin Brown - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Soup (leek, pear and potato) and Salad

pyv82_8PvjY6JNyo3NQ8BQ.text: Tasty, healthy food with friendly service and a student discount. (Previously unheard of in Grassmarket) I highly recommend the hot meal of the day (not the soup--the other one. It's usually a vegetable chili or a curry). In my experience, whatever they offer, it tastes great.   The only downside: the hot food choices are a bit limited.

Wjxuj3OiVFV_wfb9o0pBPw.text: I had the best chai latte I've ever had at Pumpkin Brown! I didn't realize they were vegan so I tried to order with whole cows milk, but then decided on hazelnut milk instead. I'd never tried a nut milk before, but the hazelnut paired perfectly with the warm, spicy chai. The latte was the perfect size and came in a nice big cup. It was absolutely delicious! Perfect for a chilly fall day.

scaqO46v-CZl_6P8ovTcRg.text: I was happy I found this vegan place while walking around the city. I wish they prepared hot food once ordered instead of warming it up. In my opinion the price is a bit high for a warm up. The food was average.

h1JtaslRiEPaQ2y_6Wp2Sg.text: This place is amazing!! It's the vegan cafe to go to in Edinburgh! My boyfriend got the rooibos latte and he said it tasted like a candle (he really likes candles!) I got the pumpkin spice latte which was also amazing. We didn't try their cakes but we certainly will next time!!

Yrwi0C9boEzTo8EHu3-CNg.text: Definitely my go to for vegan food on the go! I've been here several times and always try something new- never been disappointed. They have many options to go but also have a nice ambience inside to enjoy your meal. They have a wide variety of dairy free milks for coffee which I appreciate and also offer many vegan desserts which are excellent. The staff is incredibly kind and friendly and always strike up conversation. They are very helpful in offering recommendations as well! Highly, highly recommend!

yQz7VseRzwa0AmCD3N4hhw.text: FOOD 4 // SERVICE 3// AMBIANCE 4  First off -- I LOVE MY EMPTY CARBS ... but the fact that I was filled after having a bread-less lunch is amazing. This is a super cute cafe ; very big with lots of seating and great lighting. So most of the food is in the refrigerator and the hot meal was a soup (when I was there). There are tons of teas, coffee beverages and unique beverages like the pumpkin spice latte and turmeric latte.    I got the signature pumpkin salad (forgot the actual name) and it had tons of beans, pumpkin pieces, kale, bell pepper and cayenne pepper with a pomegranate molasses dressing along with the turmeric latte. All the beverages are dairyfree and are made of either soy or coconut milk (they had a few other milks too). The meal was flavorful and tasted so very clean! I felt so full, but in the best way, after the salad. The turmeric latte was very good as well -- I was surprised that it paired well with the coconut milk! As a proponent and fan of turmeric (haldi) I was pleased with the fact you could actually taste the turmeric. The fact that they even had this was amazing!! Turmeric is so good for your health -- definitely try it out.   Will be back to try the smoothies and some of the raw sweets they offer!

photos.caption: Photo of Pumpkin Brown - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Signature Pumpkin salad &amp;&amp; turmeric latte

AsoGxUcI52MGA65Vllhl4w.text: Lovely friendly staff but the hazelnut latte I had really wasn't very tasty. Since been back to try the date milkshake/smoothie and really just should have gone to hula - it was so thin and not worth the price at all.  The food does look good, but based on first two attempts not sure I want to risk a third?  Update - went a 3rd time and should have just gone to Hula.

UiKYgZiU4H3eC4Dlonnk1w.text: Good music. Hot meal of the day was veggie chilli on brown rice.. decent serving and delicious  No wifi though. Cafe serves healthy meals

photos.caption: Photo of Pumpkin Brown - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

9Lg1I8oTZDtRlNqZ4xZ9DQ.text: Everything is super fresh, delicious AND beautiful. The vibe is cool, if slightly under welcoming. Best roobois latte ever. Wish there were more outdoor seating. Every day their salad selection seems to change...the Moroccan Tangine one I had today was fantastic. Can't wait to come back and see what salads they have next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Pumpkin Brown - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Moroccan tangine salad.

hi2cdESuthqPBH7sA0HI2A.text: Pumpkin Brown is one of the few places in Edinburgh where you can get a lunch that's quick, easy, and healthy. The smoothie bowls are on the smaller side for the price, but the toast options are great.

photos.caption: Photo of Pumpkin Brown - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beet hummus on toast
Photo of Pumpkin Brown - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Butter beans in a tomato/balsamic sauce on toast

ShEVwm6R07zYqCdERtIHSA.text: the hot meal of the day was a vegetable stew and was delicious. All their other meal looked very yummy and I'm excited to visit to test out the rest of the menu. Not the cosiest of restaurants and is quite small so if you'd like to eat in maybe avoid going in peak periods. Definitely recommend!

HI_bK9nrjeLJMgZy9iYOhA.text: Turmeric lattes = LOVE.  I'd been looking for a cafe which serves up this mysterious new health food trend and hadn't managed to find one until I stumbled upon Pumpkin Brown in the heart of the Grassmarket. The turmeric latte was everything I'd hoped for. I wasn't disappointed and came back for another lunch and latte a few days later.  If you're looking for top quality vegan food or just a really nutritious and hearty lunch, then Pumpkin Brown is your best bet in the area. I'm talking raw cakes and bakes and delicious whole grain salads. - Matcha and turmeric lattes if you're in the mood for a hot drink; coconut water and their own fruit infused waters if you're after something refreshing and cool. There's one hot meal per day; a fact that the staff have proudly told me each time I've visited. Both times, I went for the hot option and wasn't disappointed. - They were delicious and filling meals!  I like a little patter with my afternoon meal and Pumpkin Brown staff are happy to indulge in some chat, making this a really pleasant lunch stop.  Turmeric + coconut milk = turmeric latte heaven.

q7Gs5b3l5GSpRU6AkiB8-w.text: The cafe wasn't really tasty but quite expensive. But I liked it that they offer plenty of different milks

qGm2ddNN9IIlml2rFGCrzQ.text: Such a cute little vegan cafe in the heart of Edinburgh! My hostel was right across the street so I stopped in for a Pumpkin Spice Latte- and this isn't just any Pumpkin Latter- it's made with real organic pumpkin, maple syrup, and hazelnut mylk!!! Also the worker was super sweet & down-to-earth. Highly recommend this place for a quick coffee or small meal.

_LEA_moL-didh77sw6itpA.text: Showed up at noon on a Sunday excited for vegan breakfast in Edinburgh. Sadly, they were out of bread and said they "might" have some by half past --no guarantee. Then I was told the drink menu on the wall was wrong and rather than spending 1.50 on an infused water, I'd have to buy something out of the case for 3. Settled on a smoothly that was essentially room temperature and the consistency of water. Waste of my time and money. It was such a fail because I was so looking forward to this. Vegans in Edinburgh, go elsewhere.

Gg7Wby5eTw-Uo1e3NiiqyQ.text: Really cool vegan cafe with gorgeous looking takeaway food, friendly staff and trendy decor. Smooth jazz in the background sets a nice mood and the coffee was great. But it's vegan, so you be choosing between black, soy or coconut milk! I had coconut and while strange at first, it was really quite nice.

qu9Pe3I43BesiaCDkEPIgA.text: If you have a hankering for a healthy, hearty meal in the city, look no further! This quaint little vegan take away place is a refreshing change from all the greasy pub grub! Their meals are fresh, light and very good value. The staff are very friendly and take the time to answer any questions you may have related to the meals they offer.
